intro: Lepidaploa eriolepis, commonly known as the woolly lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
